title: 103_s2052
content: TRANSFERS OF MOTORBOAT FUEL TAXES FROM HIGHWAY TRUST FUND. The amendment authorizes transfers of motorboat fuel taxes from the Highway Trust Fund to the land and water conservation fund. The amendment allows transfers of motorboat fuel taxes from the Highway Trust Fund to the land and water conservation fund, with a limitation of $1,000,000 per fiscal year. It also includes technical amendments and is effective from October 1, 1993. Technical amendments are made to the Aquatic Resources Trust Fund. Amendments are made to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 regarding the Aquatic Resources Trust Fund, including changes to sections 9504(a)(2), 9504(b)(2)(A), and 9504(c) related to fish restoration, management projects, and boat safety expenditures. Amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 were made to the Aquatic Resources Trust Fund, with changes to sections related to fish restoration, management projects, and boat safety expenditures. Effective dates for the amendments are specified as October 1, 1994 for section (a) and October 1, 1993 for sections (b) and (c). SEC. 3. Funding for recreational boating safety programs. The Act of August 9, 1950 is amended to transfer annual appropriations from the Highway Trust Fund to the Boat Safety Account for recreational boating safety programs. The Act of August 9, 1950 is amended to transfer annual appropriations from the Highway Trust Fund to the Boat Safety Account for recreational boating safety programs. The Secretary of Transportation allocates funds for boating safety programs under title 46, United States Code. The Secretary of the Interior distributes 18% of the remaining annual appropriation, with $7,500,000 for fiscal year 1995 and $10,000,000 for each of fiscal years 1996 and 1997 available for Clean Vessel Act obligations. The Clean Vessel Act of 1992 allows the Secretary of the Interior to grant funds for qualified projects. Unobligated amounts after two years will be transferred to the Secretary of Transportation for State recreational boating safety programs. Amendments to subsections (d) and (e) include changes in references. Effective date of the amendment is October 1, 1994. SEC. 4. AUTHORIZATION OF EXPENDITURES FOR RECREATIONAL BOATING SAFETY PROGRAMS. Section 13106 of title 46, United States Code, is amended to allocate $35,000,000 for recreational boating safety services provided by the Coast Guard. The Secretary is authorized to expend this amount from the operating expenses account until expended. The Secretary may expend the balance transferred to the Boat Safety Account for State recreational boating safety programs as provided under established guidelines. Amounts made available remain available until expended and released amounts are immediately available for expenditure. Amendments are made to section 13106 in the table of sections at the beginning of chapter 131 of title 46, United States Code. Amendment to section 13106 for recreational boating safety programs effective October 1, 1994.
